conclusion: Use properties of semicircular glass brick and principles of optics, specifically law of refraction and geometry.
Identify given information: radius R, angle theta = 30 degrees, distance between bright spots = (sqrt(3) + 1)R.
OO' is perpendicular to diameter AB, O is the center of semicircle, radius OO' equals R.
Using law of refraction, angle of incidence theta equals angle of reflection, theta = 30 degrees.
Angle of reflection theta' is also 30 degrees.
Using law of refraction, ratio of refractive index n of glass to index of air n0 is n = r/r0.
Radius of glass circle is R, radius of air circle is R, so n = R/R = 1.
Distance between two bright spots on screen is (sqrt(3) + 1)R, corresponds to difference in distances from center O to bright spots.
Distance from center O to two bright spots is R, distance between bright spots is (sqrt(3) + 1)R = 2R.
Using law of refraction, distance between bright spots equals difference in distances from center O to bright spots, 2R = (sqrt(3) + 1)R.
Solve for R: 2R = (sqrt(3) + 1)R, 2 = sqrt(3) + 1, 2 - 1 = sqrt(3), sqrt(3) = 1, R = 1.
Since radius R is 1, refractive index n of glass is 1.
